title: Wall Street Trades Up, For Now
sub_head: Banks delivered excellent trading results in first quarter, but capital considerations might put damper on the party
body:
Trading desks at Wall Street banks look set to keep delivering strong results, so long as their bosses give them the opportunity.
In the first quarter, Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley both grew trading revenue 4% from a year earlier. Trading revenue at Citigroup and JPMorgan Chase was down just 2% and 3%, respectively. Given some of the gloomy forecasts for trading earlier this year, and the difficult comparison with a very strong quarter in the year-earlier period, it seems that Marchâ€™s market recovery had a big effect.
